content:
These two URLs may help: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2023/07/getting-started-with-the-main-window-of-thunderbird-115-supernova/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/archived-messages

Thank you for your interest in donating to help. This URL offers online donations as well as sending check via postal mail. https://donate.mozilla.org/en-US/

If you have questions as you progress, just post your questions here and there is usually a volunteer to respond.

content: Ciao, è un bug noto di Thunderbird. Al momento che io sappia non c'è soluzione. Si spera venga risolto in un futuro aggiornamento.
creator: @next

content: Please share more information and any error messages.. SPF and DKIM must be set on the host server, and that is not something users can do unless their email account is self-hosted.
creator: davidsk

content:
I would advise that this sort of auto reponse is set up via webmail account which you access via a browser.

Why? Because if you create it in Thunderbird then computer must be left switched on and never go to sleep nor hiberate; your User Account must be logged into and Thunderbird must be running. This is not adviseable from a security point of view if you are 'not in the office'.

But if you really do want to do it then:

  • create an email with Subject eg: 'out of office' which says appolgies I 'll get back to as as soon as possible or whatever you want to say and save as a 'Template'.

It then gets saved in the 'Templates' folder.

In 'Message Filters'

  • Create a new filter named Out of Office
  • Apply filter when 'Getting new mail'
  • Suggest you use 'Filter After junk Calssification' because you do not really want to be reponding to junk mail.
  • Select 'Match all the following'
  • Select 'To' 'contains' and type your email address

So only responding to emails sent to you. Action:

  • select 'Reply with Template' and choose the 'Out of Office' template you created.

Make sure this message filter is not enabled until required.
creator: Toad-Hall
